task.title: How to Use the Browser Developer Tools to Change the Figures Titles Format
task.shortdesc: This is an example of how to use the developer tools available in a browser to identify and modify the styling and formatting of a figure's title.

prereq.p: A publishing template and a customization CSS should already be set up for your transformation. See more details in the section.

context.p: This shows how to modify the separator character between the 'Figure NN' text and the figure title, and alter the caption color to blue.

step.cmd: Start by applying the customized CSS based PDF transformation.
step.info: After the transformation, you can see that the figure title is not colored and the delimiter between the figure number and the actual title text is the dot "."

step.cmd: In the output folder locate the *.merged.html file.
step.info: This file contains the contents of the entire DITA Map, converted to HTML. It contains also links to the customization CSS files.

step.cmd: Open the HTML file into a web browser, for example in Chrome.
Scroll to the figure and select some text from its title.

info.p: Now the browser changes layout and we can see in the left side the HTML content, in the middle the structure of the HTML document.
It is possible to hover over the elements from the structure and see in the left side the corresponding content.

The figure title is placed in a HTML figcaption element. We can use the right side pane element.style to change the selected element style. This is good for testing, but in order to have the styling persistent you need to create a CSS rule in the customization CSS.

step.cmd: Open your customization CSS and add a selector that matches the figcaption element.
In order to change the symbol between the number of the figure and the title, you can also use the inspector and check the figure structure.
